meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Macau, equal to 100 avos.
meanings.sent1: In Macau, you can buy many things with just one pataca.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for patacas before the trip.
meanings.sent3: The pataca rolled off the table and into the piggy bank.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny pataca, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the pataca hitting the metal tray was satisfying.

meanings.definition: A former monetary unit of Portuguese Timor, equal to 100 centavos.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather used to tell stories about the old pataca in Timor.
meanings.sent2: Collectors seek rare coins, including the old pataca.
meanings.sent3: The pirate's treasure chest was full of ancient patacas.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of Timor were like faded patacas, valuable but distant.
meanings.sent5: The antique shop displayed a collection of historic patacas.
